name: TVET Egypt
description: TVET Egypt (Technical and Vocational Education and Training) is a national reform initiative co-funded by the Egyptian government and the European Union. It aims to enhance the employability of youth, improve the quality of technical education, and bridge the gap between labor market needs and vocational training. TVET Egypt operates across all 27 governorates, supporting human capital development and entrepreneurship.
address: Cairo, Egypt

name: Ashoka Arab World
description: Ashoka Arab World has been a pioneer of social entrepreneurship in Egypt and the region since 2003. It identifies and supports visionary changemakers who tackle systemic social challenges through innovative, scalable solutions. Ashoka’s Fellows lead transformative initiatives in health, education, environment, and civic engagement.
address: Cairo, Egypt

name: Endeavor Egypt
description: Endeavor Egypt is part of the global Endeavor network, launched in 2008 to support high-impact entrepreneurs who scale businesses, create jobs, and inspire others. It focuses on founders with the potential to transform industries and drive economic growth.
address: Zamalek, Cairo, Cairo Governorate

name: International Labor Organization
description: The ILO has supported Egypt since 1936 in promoting decent work, labor rights, and inclusive entrepreneurship. Through its Cairo office, the ILO runs targeted programs to empower youth, refugees, and vulnerable communities by enhancing employability and supporting enterprise development.
address: Zamalek, Cairo

name: International Council for Small Business
description: ICSB Egypt is part of the global ICSB network, promoting entrepreneurship, SME development, and inclusive innovation. Egypt plays a strategic role in ICSB’s regional efforts, hosting flagship events and engaging with local universities, policymakers, and entrepreneurs.
address: Cairo, Egypt (via local partners such as AUC and RiseUp)

name: Forsa - Ministry of Social Solidarity
description: Forsa is Egypt’s national economic empowerment initiative targeting vulnerable groups. It helps beneficiaries of the Takaful and Karama programs transition to self-reliance through employment and entrepreneurship.
address: Nasr City, Cairo

name: Egypt Entrepreneurship and Innovation Center
description: Established in 2023 under the National Institute for Governance and Sustainable Development, EEIC is Egypt’s central hub for entrepreneurship and innovation. It aims to integrate local startups into global value chains and promote sustainable innovation.
address: Cairo, Egypt

name: Technology Innovation and Entrepreneurship Center
description: TIEC, launched in 2010 under Egypt’s Ministry of Communications and Information Technology, is a national hub for innovation and entrepreneurship in ICT. It empowers startups through incubation, funding, and ecosystem development.
address: Smart Village, Giza

name: Egyptian Banking Institute (EBI)
description: Established in 1991 as the official training arm of the Central Bank of Egypt, EBI is dedicated to developing human capital in the banking and financial sectors. It also plays a growing role in entrepreneurship education, financial literacy, and SME support across Egypt and Africa.
address: Nasr City, Cairo, Nasr City, EG

name: AASTMT
description: AASTMT is a regional university affiliated with the League of Arab States, with campuses across Egypt including Smart Village. Beyond its academic programs, AASTMT plays a strategic role in entrepreneurship, innovation, and SME development through its dedicated Entrepreneurship Center.
address: Smart Village Campus, Cairo, Egypt

name: Innovators Support Fund (ISF)
description: Established under Law No. 1 of 2019, ISF operates under Egypt’s Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research. It aims to discover, train, and fund gifted individuals, researchers, and entrepreneurs across all disciplines—from school students to university graduates and professionals.
address: 101 Al Qasr El Einy street, 8th floor, Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research.

name: Micro, Small and Medium Enterprise Development Agency (MSMEDA)
description: MSMEDA is Egypt’s national authority for MSME development, established by Prime Ministerial Decree No. 947 of 2017. It evolved from the Social Fund for Development (1991) and now serves as a central policy integrator, funder, and ecosystem builder for entrepreneurship and inclusive growth.
address: Dokki, Giza, Egypt.

name: Gemini Africa
description: Founded by Orascom Investment Holding, Gemini Africa is a one-stop entrepreneurial hub focused on empowering startups across Africa, with a strong emphasis on creative industries, social impact, and underserved regions. It bridges the gap between startups and investors through mentorship, funding, and strategic matchmaking.
address: Al Agouza, Giza, Egypt

name: Academy of Scientific Research and Technology (ASRT)
description: Established in 1971, ASRT is Egypt’s national think tank and innovation engine under the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research. It drives science-based policy, funds applied research, and supports entrepreneurship through incubation, competitions, and regional development programs.
address: Cairo, Egypt

name: icealex
description: ICEALEX, an innovation consultancy firm, is a leading platform for sector specific incubations, and acts as a community-driven technology innovation hub with a strong social and environmental commitment.The main approach for ice activities is to provide an enabling ecosystem for action-oriented minds co-creating sustainable solutions for local challenges and transforming them into sustainable businesses.
address: Al Azaritah, Alexandria

name: CREATIVA
description: Creativa is a national initiative launched by MCIT with the aim of promoting the new technology support standard for youth in Egypt. The initiative bridges the gap between technology skills and on the ground requirements from the market. The Creativa hubs are available in Mansoura, Monufia , Menia , Sohag, Qena and Aswan, with each hub providing a unique offering for the local community based on demand. The initiative empowers youth by linking technology skills with the required demand driver ranging from the future job market, freelancing/ remote job market and the entrepreneurial activities.

name: enactus
description: Enactus utilizes team-based experiential learning and competition to catalyze young people to take positive entrepreneurial action in their communities. Through their efforts, our students make a positive impact on people, the planet, and our shared prosperity – and contribute to achieving the Global Goals.

name: IHub
description: To foster an enabling environment for innovation and entrepreneurship, and to advance research and development directed toward the needs of industry and businesses. Our mission is to contribute to industrial localization and technology transfer by promoting collaboration between universities and business sectors, and by providing the resources and knowledge necessary to transform ideas into innovative solutions and products that drive economic and social development, while helping to bridge the gap between imports and exports.

name: Egypt Innovate
description: Egypt Innovates is an electronic platform for innovation in Egypt, providing a source of inspiration, education, and communication for innovators and entrepreneurs. We will take you on a journey through educational and inspiring content, practical tools, and models, and you will enjoy the freedom to access networks of hubs and innovation spaces around the world.Egypt Innovates aims to shed light on Egyptian innovators locally and globally, create points of convergence among them, and build collaborative communities among representatives of the Egyptian innovation and entrepreneurship environment. Additionally, the platform aims to educate innovators and startups about technology and innovation management.SME Support: financial service, feasibility studies, Debt advisory, Bookkeeping & tax services, and CFO outsourcing

name: Delta Square
description: Delta Square is a company based in Egypt that focuses on innovation and technology. It operates as an "Innovation Enablement Platform" with a mission to bridge the gap between people and new technologies. The company achieves this through various programs, competitions, and capacity-building initiatives.SME Support: financial service, feasibility studies, Debt advisory, Bookkeeping & tax services, and CFO outsourcing
address: 122 Othman Ibn Affan Street, 2nd floor, Heliopolis, Cairo 11736, EG

name: IEEE Young Professionals Egypt
description: IEEE Young Professionals (YP) Egypt is the national affinity group of IEEE for students and early-career engineers. It delivers large-scale programs such as Egyptian Engineering Day (EED), Made in Egypt (MIE), NASA Space Apps Cairo, Future City, and structured mentoring through Mentoring Meet cohorts. The group earned IEEE Region 8 recognition for outstanding activities in collaboration with universities and industry.
address: Egypt Section (no single HQ address; events held nationwide).

name: BznsBuilder
description: BznsBuilder is an AI‑powered platform for business planning, financial forecasting, and investor‑ready documentation. It helps founders model revenue and costs, run scenarios, and generate visual dashboards. The software is used by startups, SMEs, universities and accelerators to standardize plans and improve funding readiness.
address: 49 Abd El-Hameed Badawi, Al Matar, El Nozha, Cairo Governorate, Egypt

name: CEO Business School (C.E.O.)
description: CEO Business School is an Egyptian training and higher-education provider offering MBA/DBA programs and executive diplomas. It specializes in administration, finance, HR, and operations tracks, serving managers and founders seeking practical skills.
address: 33 Al-Sad Al Aali Street, Finney Square, Dokki, Cairo, Egypt

name: Portolearn
description: Portolearn provides live and online training in business, analytics, IT, and project management. Its public programming features domain experts and case-based content, with active learner communities hosted on Facebook.
address: 5 Sunrise Buildings, 3rd Floor 28QW+4F, Nasr City, Egypt.

name: Octopus – Scientific Awareness Initiative
description: Octopus is a youth-led scientific awareness initiative in Egypt focused on aquaculture, environmental stewardship, and blue-economy literacy. It delivers Arabic-language outreach, events, and content to improve access to scientific knowledge.
address: El-Kafori Street, Cairo, Egypt.

name: AUEC – Aswan University Entrepreneurship Club
description: The club trains students in business development abilities through its scheduled events. It provides educational sessions and competitions that enable students to create new business concepts and make industry-professional connections.it helps building a generation of entrepreneurs who can participate locally, regionally and internationally in developing their societies with thought, science and innovation.
address: Azhar University campus, Egypt.

name: MET – Misr Higher Institute for Engineering & Technology
description: MET Mansoura is a higher‑education institute offering engineering and technology programs. It supports applied learning through labs and public e‑learning resources.
address: Ring Road, Mansoura, Egypt.

name: Startup Grind Cairo
description: Local chapters of the global Startup Grind community. They host monthly events, founder fireside chats, and networking sessions that connect founders, mentors and investors.
address: New Cairo, Cairo, Egypt

name: Entreprenelle
description: Entreprenelle is a mission-driven organization founded in 2015 that empowers women entrepreneurs across Egypt. It reports supporting 100,000+ women and generating EGP 100M+ in economic value through programs, mentorship and access to partners.
address: Space 803, Building 4, Street 151, Maadi, Cairo.

name: AASTMT – Arab Academy for Science, Technology & Maritime Transport
description: AASTMT is a regional university under the Arab League with campuses across Egypt. It provides degree programs and professional training, and hosts entrepreneurship and innovation initiatives through its colleges and centers.
address: Abu Qir, Alexandria (Main campus); multiple campuses nationwide.

name: Om Habibeh Foundation (OHF) – AKDN
description: OHF is a locally registered NGO in Aswan (est. 1991) and an implementing agency for Aga Khan Foundation Egypt. It delivers programs in livelihoods, education, health, and civil society, and has reached tens of thousands of beneficiaries in Aswan.
address: El‑Sadat Road, opposite Dr. Soliman Hospital, Aswan, Egypt.

name: Fekretak Sherketak (GAFI Entrepreneurship Center)
description: Fekretak Sherketak is GAFI’s national entrepreneurship platform providing training, mentorship, and a one‑stop Investor Services Centre. In 2025, it launched a Fast Track to accelerate startup establishment and licensing procedures.
address: GAFI HQ, 3 Salah Salem St., Nasr City, Cairo 11562.

name: NubiAvest
description: NubiAvest is a platform and micro‑business studio focused on creative industries, green economy and tourism, with strong roots in Upper Egypt. It runs a Micro Business Studio program and partners with ecosystem actors such as enpact and Startup Haus Cairo.
address: wadi karkar st.10 , Aswan, Egypt

name: Fab Lab Egypt (San3a Tech)
description: Fab Lab Egypt is a makerspace and innovation lab offering access to digital fabrication tools (3D printing, CNC, laser cutting), prototyping services, and training. It supports startups, students, and corporates with lab access and custom innovation programs.
address: Villa 35, 100 Street, near Al Horia Square, Maadi, Cairo.

name: INJAZ Egypt
description: INJAZ Egypt (est. 2003) delivers experiential learning in entrepreneurship, work readiness, and financial literacy through school and university programs and a large corporate volunteer network. Impact reports cite hundreds of thousands of students served.
address: El‑Shaikh Rihan, Abdeen, Cairo (office); historic address: 52 Corniche El‑Maadi.

name: ASRT – Academy of Scientific Research & Technology
description: ASRT is Egypt’s national body for coordinating scientific research and innovation policy. It operates funding programs, IP services, and national initiatives such as the Children’s University.
address: 101 Kasr Al‑Aini St., Cairo 11516, Egypt.

name: Made in Egypt (MIE) – IEEE YP Competition
description: MIE is a national competition founded by IEEE Young Professionals Egypt that helps senior students turn graduation projects into startups by linking them with business mentorship and exposure.

name: Enactus Egypt
description: Enactus Egypt supports student teams that build social enterprise projects. It runs the annual national competition and connects teams to the global Enactus network.
address: Villa 101, District 8, 3rd Neighborhood, Sheikh Zayed, Giza.

name: Eitesal
description: EiTESAL for Information & Communication Technology is Egypt’s foremost private non-profit organization that has been actively and powerfully supporting the ICT industry in Egypt since 2004. It has played a significant and vital role in building and developing the ICT sector in the last 20 years.
address: 22 Dessouk St., off Al-Imam Aly, Ismailia Square, Heliopolis

name: EPEA - Egyptian Private Equity Association
description: EPEA is a nonprofit association committed to supporting and developing the Private Equity and Venture Capital industry in Egypt and the surrounding region.
address: 22 Mohamed Saeed El Halawani Street, Orouba Road, Heliopolis, Cairo, Egypt.

name: AWTAD
description: The Association for Women’s Total Advancement and Development (AWTAD) is an NGO dedicated to the professional and personal development of Egyptian women and youth as a means to empower them on both the social and economic level.
address: 19 151 Street, Maadi, Cairo, Egypt

name: GESR
description: GESR is a program affiliated to Misr El-Kheir Foundation launched in 2013, showcasing its responsibility to contribute to a knowledge-based economy, through supporting innovators and technology startups solving social challenges in the fields of Water, Energy, Food, Health, Education, AI and IOT.
address: 4 El Ahram Street, El Nafoura Square, Al Mokattam, Cairo, Egypt.

name: ACSR
description: The Arab Council for Social Responsibility “ACSR” : is a member in the UN Global Compact and the first council in Egypt that aims to be the platform for community development in the Arab region for both sharing experiences and helping in the developmental process. The council have a wide number of partners nationally, regionally and internationally.
address: 106 Canadian School St.- Fourth district - fifth settlement.

name: Enactus
description: Enactus is the world’s largest experiential learning platform dedicated to creating a better world while developing the next generation of entrepreneurial leaders and social innovators. The Enactus network of global business, academic and student leaders are unified by our vision - to create a better, more sustainable world.
address: Villa 101, District 8, 3rd Neighborhood, Sheikh Zayed, Giza.

name: DTA
description: DTA is a non-profit organization that works as a hub for IT business people committed to develop a solid base of Entrepreneurship and Innovation culture to serve developing an IT Industry in Nile Delta Of Egypt.
address: Al Qanah Tower, 9th Floor, Suez Canal Street, Mansoura, DK, Egypt.

name: Giza Systems
description: Giza Systems, a digital transformation enabler and a leading systems integrator in the MEA region designs and deploys industry-specific technology solutions for asset-intensive industries such as the Telecoms, Utilities, Oil & Gas, Urban Communities, Smart Mobility and other market sectors. Giza Systems is part of the solutions by stc group of companies.
address: City Center Plot 176, Second Sector, New Cairo 1, Cairo Governorate 11835, Egypt.

name: EDEA
description: Economic Development & Entrepreneurship Association (EDEA) is a nongovernmental organization. EDEA members are business people, society, entrepreneurs and MSMEs owners. Enabling MSMEs to enhance economic and social development in Egypt.
address: Alexandria/Egypt.

name: YLF
description: Youth Leaders Foundation (YLF) is a non-profit organization with a registered number 809 for 2017 providing targeted services to find hidden calibres to support and strengthen Egypt’s youth segment.
address: 108 belal ibn rabaha 5 settlement, Cairo Governorate/Egypt.

name: MALAIKAH
description: Malaikah-EGYBAN acts as the voice of the angel investment community, we represent the views and interests of the angel investment community to business leaders, government officials so as to link relevant and interested key players together.
address: 76- Abdel Moneim Riyad St. El Mohandeseen, 2nd Floor, Office 201. Cairo, Egypt

name: World Food Programme (WFP Egypt)
description: WFP is the UN’s food assistance arm, active in Egypt since 1968. While traditionally focused on nutrition and humanitarian aid, WFP has expanded into entrepreneurship, youth empowerment, and climate-smart innovation, aligning with Egypt Vision 2030 and the Haya Kareema initiative.
address: 12 Mohamed Mahmoud Street, Garden City, Cairo, Egypt

name: Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA Egypt)
description: JICA is Japan’s official development agency, operating in Egypt since 1977. It supports inclusive growth, human capital development, and entrepreneurship through technical cooperation, grant aid, and public-private partnerships. JICA’s work in Egypt spans education, industrial development, and startup support—especially through innovation competitions and university partnerships.
address: World Trade Center, 6th Floor, 1191 Corniche El Nile, Boulak, Cairo, Egypt

name: Islamic Corporation for the Insurance of Investment and Export Credit (ICIEC)
description: ICIEC is a member of the Islamic Development Bank (IsDB) Group, headquartered in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. It provides Sharia-compliant investment and export credit insurance to support trade and foreign direct investment in OIC member countries, including Egypt. ICIEC plays a strategic role in de-risking entrepreneurship, SME growth, and infrastructure development by enabling access to finance and cross-border trade.
address: Operates via IsDB Regional Hub – Boomerang Building, 90th Street, New Cairo, Egypt

name: European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) – Egypt
description: EBRD is a multilateral development bank focused on private sector development and transition economies. Egypt became a country of operation in 2012, and since then, EBRD has invested over €10.3 billion in 160+ projects. Its work in Egypt emphasizes entrepreneurship, youth employment, financial inclusion, and green innovation.

name: European Investment Bank (EIB) – Egypt
description: The EIB is the European Union’s development bank and a key financier of Egypt’s infrastructure, entrepreneurship, and green economy transition. Through its arm EIB Global, the bank supports inclusive growth, SME development, and innovation ecosystems. Egypt has been a partner since 1979, with over €13.7 billion invested across 118 projects.

name: International Finance Corporation (IFC) – Egypt
description: IFC is the private sector arm of the World Bank Group, focused on promoting inclusive economic growth through investment and advisory services. In Egypt, IFC supports entrepreneurship, fintech innovation, and SME development, with a strong emphasis on youth employment, financial inclusion, and digital transformation.
address: World Bank Group Office, 10th Floor, 6A Midan Simón Bolívar, Garden City, Cairo, Egypt

name: GIZ Egypt – Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit
description: GIZ is Germany’s official development agency, operating in Egypt on behalf of the Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ). GIZ supports Egypt’s transition toward inclusive employment, entrepreneurship, and green economy transformation. Its programs focus on youth, women, SMEs, and public-private partnerships, with strong alignment to Egypt’s Vision 2030.
address: 4A El Gezira Street, Garden City, Cairo, Egypt

name: Islamic Development Bank (IsDB)
description: IsDB is a multilateral development bank headquartered in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, with Egypt as a founding member. Through its Regional Hub in Cairo, IsDB supports inclusive development, youth empowerment, entrepreneurship, and infrastructure across Egypt and neighboring countries. Its work aligns with the SDGs and Egypt’s Vision 2030, emphasizing human capital, innovation, and resilience.
address: 6th Floor, Plot 46, Financial Center, Boomerang Building, 90th Street, New Cairo, Egypt

name: Danish International Development Agency (DANIDA)
description: DANIDA is Denmark’s official development cooperation arm, operating under the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. In Egypt, DANIDA works through the Danish Embassy and the Danish-Arab Partnership Programme (DAPP), focusing on youth employment, entrepreneurship, human rights, and governance.
address: Embassy of Denmark, 13 El Sheikh Mohamed Abd El Wahab Street, Zamalek, Cairo, Egypt

name: Global Affairs Canada
description: Canada’s development cooperation with Egypt is managed through Global Affairs Canada. With a focus on inclusive economic growth, youth empowerment, and climate-smart job creation, Canada supports talent development through strategic partnerships in education, agribusiness, and technical training.
address: Embassy of Canada, 26 Ahmed Heshmat Street, Zamalek, Cairo, Egypt

name: United States Agency for International Development (USAID Egypt)
description: USAID has supported Egypt’s development for over four decades, focusing on education, economic growth, and entrepreneurship. Through initiatives like SEED, Business Egypt, and the Economic Governance Activity, USAID strengthens talent pipelines, incubators, and innovation hubs—especially for youth and women.
address: 1/A Nady El Etisalat Street, New Maadi, Cairo, Egypt

name: Mitcha
description: Mitcha, launched in 2018 by Hilda Louca, is Egypt’s premier multi-brand fashion ecommerce platform. Its mission is to unite and showcase over 300 homegrown Egyptian designers on a curated, internationally-standard digital platform, bringing local fashion to both local and global audiences.
address: 5 Fatma El Sharbatly Square, Cairo, Egypt

name: Women-UP (Egyptian Initiative)
description: Women-UP is a national initiative funded by the European Union and coordinated by the Academy of Scientific Research and Technology (ASRT) in collaboration with the SEKEM Development Foundation and Techno Khair for Development – Assuit. It aims to enhance the capabilities and sustainability of women-led businesses across Egypt.
address: Academy of Scientific Research and Technology (Women-UP Project Coordinator), 101 Kasr Al-Aini Street, 6th floor, 11516, Cairo, Egypt

name: World Food Programme (WFP)
description: The World Food Programme (WFP) is the food-assistance branch of the United Nations and the largest humanitarian organization globally, providing food support and capacity-building to communities in need. In Egypt, WFP works closely with government and local partners to secure food and nutrition, strengthen resilience, support livelihoods, and enhance institutional capacity.
address: WFP Egypt Country Office, 49 Road 105, Maadi, Cairo, Egypt

name: She Leads - Youth Leaders Foundation (YLF), Egypt
description: She Leads is the pioneering initiative by the Youth Leaders Foundation (YLF) focused on empowering young women in vocational and technical education across Egypt. YLF is a non-profit organization established in 2017 by young professionals to support Egyptian youth, aligning with Egypt’s Vision 2030 and the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals through cross-sector partnerships.
address: 108A Belal Ibn Rabah, 5th Settlement, Cairo Governorate, Egypt

name: TIEC (Technology Innovation & Entrepreneurship Center)
description: The Technology Innovation & Entrepreneurship Center (TIEC), established in September 2010, operates under Egypt’s Information Technology Industry Development Agency (ITIDA) and Ministry of Communications and Information Technology (MCIT). Its mission is to catalyze innovation, promote ICT entrepreneurship, and drive the creation of intellectual property within Egypt's tech ecosystem.
address: Smart Village, Building B5, Cairo–Alexandria Desert Road, Abou Rawash, Giza, Egypt

name: Businessita
description: Businessita is a Cairo-based ecosystem enabler dedicated to empowering social entrepreneurs and women-led ventures. They emphasize a unique “Psychology in Business” approach—integrating self-awareness, mindset, and emotional intelligence with strategy and operations to nurture more holistic, sustained entrepreneurial success.
address: 146 Nasr Street, New Maadi, Cairo, Egypt

name: Assiut Business Women Association (ABWA)
description: The Assiut Business Women Association (ABWA) is a non-profit organization established in the year 2000. Based in Assiut, Egypt, ABWA focuses on empowering marginalized women through economic development and capacity-building initiatives.
address: Assiut, El Gomhoureya St, Osman Ibn Affan Towers, Main Entrance, Assiut, 71111, Egypt

name: Rabeha
description: "Rabeha" (meaning “winner” in Arabic) is a five-year joint initiative, spearheaded by UN Women and UNIDO, aimed at economically empowering women across Egypt. The programme focuses on capacity building, job placement, entrepreneurial support, and integration into sustainable value chains.
address: UN Women Egypt Office: 21 Al Nahda Street, Maadi, Cairo

name: Conseil Consulting EG
description: Conseil Consulting EG is a Cairo-based consultancy firm focused on business and management transformation, strategic planning, and organizational excellence. Under the leadership of Dr. Dina Yacout (MCIM, CMKtr), the firm delivers tailored consulting, training, research, and capacity-building services across institutions, private entities, and nonprofits.

name: Women Entrepreneurs Network (WEN)
description: The Women Entrepreneurs Network (WEN) is Egypt’s first entrepreneurial “network of networks,” established in 2018 with support from USAID and currently backed by the Business Egypt project. It connects member organizations across diverse sectors and regions to create a vibrant ecosystem supporting both emerging and established women entrepreneurs.
address: 22 Anwar ElMufti Street, Tiba 2000 Administrative Building, Nasr City, Cairo, Egypt

name: CinemaTech
description: CinemaTech is the world’s first entrepreneurial track specifically designed to inject technological solutions into the entertainment industry—spanning film, TV, and related creative sectors. It is powered by Gemini Africa, in partnership with the Academy of Scientific Research & Technology (ASRT).
address: 160 26th July Corridor, Agouza, Giza, Egypt

name: Om Habibeh Foundation (OHF)
description: The Om Habibeh Foundation is a long-standing Egyptian non-profit founded in 1991. It operates as the Egyptian affiliate of the Aga Khan Development Network (AKDN) and is supervised by the Ministry of Social Solidarity. Based in Aswan, the Foundation advances community development across health, education, early childhood, agriculture, women’s empowerment, and economic inclusion.
address: El-Sadat Road, opposite Dr. Soliman Hospital, Aswan, Egypt

name: IEEE Young Professionals
description: IEEE Young Professionals (YP) Egypt is an affinity group under IEEE Egypt Section dedicated to empowering engineers, technologists, and innovators in the early stages of their careers (typically IEEE members who graduated within the past 15 years). It provides professional development opportunities, leadership training, networking, and exposure to cutting-edge technology trends.
address: IEEE Egypt Section / IEEE Young Professionals Egypt, 101 El Kasr El Aini Street, 3rd Floor, Cairo, Egypt (ASRT Building, IEEE Egypt HQ)

name: Inno101 Accelerator
description: Inno101 is a Cairo-based startup accelerator focusing on technology-driven and digital transformation startups. It helps both early-stage and growth-stage ventures refine business models, validate product-market fit, and prepare for scaling.
address: Cairo, Egypt

name: Athar Accelerator

name: EdVentures

address: Giza, Egypt

address: AASTMT, Cairo & Alexandria

description: Part of Orange Group’s digital inclusion initiative, offering coding, FabLab, and startup acceleration.
address: Cairo, Egypt

name: TEQDAR Accelerator Program – Banque Misr

address: Cairo, Egypt

description: Fundraising-focused accelerator by AASTMT Entrepreneurship Center.

description: ElRehla offers immersive, four-day retreat experiences designed for entrepreneurs, founders, industry leaders, and corporate teams. name: MAGNiTT
description: MAGNiTT is a Dubai-based startup data platform (Software-as-a-Service) that provides data, analytics, insights, and reports on venture capital, startups and investors across the Middle East, Africa, Pakistan, Turkey and Southeast Asia.
address: Innovation One Building, Level 10, DIFC, Dubai, UAE

name: UNICA (Unica Research)
description: UNICA (Unica Research) is the first market research agency in Egypt dedicated to serving startups and SMEs, founded by Engy Abdelwahab.

name: The Egyptian Center for Economic Studies (ECES)
description: The Egyptian Center for Economic Studies (ECES) is an independent, non-profit think tank established in 1992 that specialises in economic research and policy analysis.

name: ICRP Egypt & MENA
description: ICRP Egypt & MENA (International Center for Research & Production) is a market research and consulting firm based in Cairo.
address: Cairo, Egypt

description: An independent research unit established in 1984 at Cairo University’s Faculty of Economics and Political Science. CEFRS conducts applied economic and financial studies to inform policy and support decision-makers.
address: Faculty of Economics and Political Science, Cairo University, Giza, Egypt

name: GISR Institution for Survey Research
description: GISR Institution for Survey Research is an independent survey research centre in Egypt devoted to gathering and analysing public opinions.
address: 35 El Hussein Street, Dokki, Giza, Egypt

ACSR encourages enterprises in all sectors to integrate social, environmental, ethical, human rights, and consumer concerns into their business operations and strategies, fostering positive impacts on society and stakeholders.
